TI_TEXT.P: Работи по изтегляне на кабели за електрически инсталации

TITLE.P: Electrical Periodic Inspection & Testing (including remedial works) — Aberdeen/Aberdeenshire/Moray

SHORT_DESCR.P: Langstane and Castlehill Housing Associations are Social Housing Providers with head offices located in Aberdeen City. Both Associations are jointly procuring an Electrical Test and Inspection contract which will include remedial works in their properties located in Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire and the Moray areas. The Contract will involve the successful Service Provider/s undertaking Electrical Periodic Inspections in occupied dwellings. The provider/s will undertake testing, providing a EICR upon completion in an electronic format. The contract will include CAT 1, CAT 2 and some CAT 3 remedial works. Portable Appliance Testing will also form a small part of the contract. The contract will consist of 6 lots and contractors can bid for 1 lot or multiple lots.
The contract period will run for 36 months from the Commencement Date (with an optional extension of a further 12+12 months), extensions are dependent on performance.

Langstane and Castlehill Housing Association's are seeking to establish a Contract for the provision of Electrical Periodic Inspection and Testing services, Portable Appliance Testing and CAT 1/Cat2 and some CAT 3 remedial works with a suitably experienced and qualified Contractor. The Contract is intended to commence not later than 1.5.2018 and will operate for three years (with the option for an extension of 1 + 1 further years), subject to satisfactory performance of the successful Bidder which will be measured through the Key Performance Indicators. The Contract will be split into lots, bidders will have the opportunity bid for 1 or multiple lots. The anticipated Contract Value for lot 1 is GBP 75 000 per annum.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Contract is intended to commence not later than 1.5.2018 and will operate for three years (with the option for an extension of 1 + 1 further years), subject to satisfactory performance of the successful Bidder which will be measured through the Key Performance Indicators.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: This procurement will be conducted through the use of the Restricted Procedure. All queries about this procurement must be made via the PCS messaging system. The process we will apply will be:

— statements including the specific requirements can be found in section 111.1.1,111.1.12 and 111.13 of the Contract Notice. Bidders must pass the minimum standards section of the ESPD (Scotland). Part 111 and Section B of part IV will be scored ona pass/fail basis, section C of PArt IV of the ESPD (Scotland) will be scored using the scoring methodology in the project particulars and quality methodology requirement document.

INFO_ADD.P: Total number of properties in lot 1: 2475 (over 5 years).
5 yearly Periodic Electrical Inspection Condition Report including CAT 1, CAT 2 and some CAT 3 remedial works to housing stock.

Please direct all queries to via PCS, no direct queries to either Housing Association will be answered.

NOTE: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland Web Site at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=525146.

The buyer has indicated that it will accept electronic responses to this notice via the Postbox facility. A user guide is available at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/sitehelp/help_guides.aspx.
Suppliers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems.
A sub-contract clause has been included in this contract. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2363.
Community benefits are included in this requirement. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2361.
A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:

Contractors will be esxpected to take part and contribute in a local project each year working with both associations. The project will be a contribution of time and have a maximum cost to the contractor of GBP 200.00 per lot up to a maximum of GBP 1200.00. An example of a community project could be volunteering a member of staff to take part in a community clean up, providing electrical improvements to a community centre and a dontation to Langstane's or Castlehills Charity of the year.
Download the ESPD document here: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/ESPD/ESPD_Download.aspx?id=525146.
